result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquee L Hoskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 2 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation
Defendant is not to use or possess any type of dangerous weapon.  Forfeiture of weapon located in the defendant's car.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must petition the court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No contact with Breion O.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with Non-Working hours with Standard Release Conditions-To commence 11/30/2015 at 5:00 p.m.  Last 60 days STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Marquee L Hoskins in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Pecora makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
1 year Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit -2 days).  
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain/Obtain employment;
No contact with Breion O. 
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Defendant is not to use or possess any type of dangerous weapon;
Forfeiture of weapon located in the defendant's car
Condition Time: 120 days jail with Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence 11/30/2015 @ 5:00 pm.   Last 60 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-11-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Marquee L Hoskins in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Bryan Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count number 2 is dismissed and read in.  Defendant request time to speak with his counsel.  Court steps down.  Court reconvenes at 2:40 pm. State makes recommendations.  Attorney Pecora makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court cannot accept the defendant's plea at this time and gives the defendant time to speak with his counsel.  Court adjourns this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-08-2015 02:15 pm
Defendant Marquee L Hoskins in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marquee L Hoskins in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs additional time to seek counsel.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to have no contact with  co defendantvictim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Marquee L Hoskins in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant was provided with Application for County appointed attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
